result.execSummary:
The defendant Isidor Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Physically Disabled [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Total term of confinement in WSP is 42 months; 18 months initial confinement; 24 months extended supervision, STAYED and placed on Probation.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review. (This pertains to PROBATION only)
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Participate in a caregiver support group/seek home healthcare if Linda L returns home.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with Linda L. 
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA, DV, and Victim/Witness surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision if revoked, otherwise due during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. 
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

miscConds.notes: PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION CONDITIONS ARE THE SAME.

charges.descr: Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isidor Lopez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isidor Lopez in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  Court would like the defendant to not live with the victim at this time.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Isidor Lopez in court with attorney Craig A. Mastantuono.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isidor Lopez in court with attorney Craig A. Mastantuono.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 42 MONTHS, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Participate in a caregiver support group/seek home healthcare if Linda L returns home.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with Linda L. 
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA, DV, and Victim/Witness surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision if revoked, otherwise due during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. 
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Per Chief Judge Directive 06-01A, this case is reassigned to Judge       for Reconfinement Review Hearing.  Reconfinement Review from the Department of Corrections, filed.  mjs

Defendant Isidor Lopez in court with attorney Craig A Mastantuono.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Psychological Evaluation received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Isidor Lopez in court with attorney Craig A Mastantuono.  Ryan T Sanson for Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isidor Lopez in court with attorney Leah Thomas for Craig A Mastantuono.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea hearing.  Court is in trial and cannot hear the matter.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Isidor Lopez in court with attorney Craig A. Mastantuono.  Matthew Torbenson for Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Information filed.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isidor Lopez in court with attorney Craig A. Mastantuono.  Ryan Sanson for Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court ordered case adjourned for to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Arraignment scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isidor Lopez in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
